comment.name: Comment
comment.text:
Afternoon Report


Last Updated: 2/17/26 | 2:42PM 

How are everyone's legs feeling? You'll be forgiven if your answer is "sore" - with weather this good, it's hard to take a break. Unfortunately for your legs, the week just looks like it's getting better and better.

For tonight, the grooming team will be back at it, covering their standard slate of trails. At 83 groomed runs, they log some serious miles under the cover of dark, so join us in thanking them for all of their efforts.

While this week's warm and sunny weather has been a nice break, we're looking forward to some snow, and Mother Nature agrees. We're tracking snow coming in on Friday into Saturday. Forecasts are still coming into focus, but we're looking squarely at 6-8" as of this writing. We'll have more info as the weekend approaches, but locking in your lift tickets and lodging now is probably a smart move. 

Stay hydrated, do some stretches, and don't forget your sunscreen and lip balm. The week just keeps getting better and we don't want you to miss any of it.

We'll see you out there!

-Team Snow

comment.name: Comment 2
comment.text:
Last Updated: 2/17/26 | 6:42AM 

Is anyone else still buzzing about how incredibly good yesterday was? Just us? The sun was shining, the temps were perfect, and the woods were good. That's a great day in our book. Luckily, we get to do it all again today.

This morning, some flurries accompanied by clouds are in the area, but are forecast to yield to partly cloudy skies around 9AM. Temps should reach the mid-30s at their highest today, so keep that in mind when layering today. 

On the operations side of things, 3D got a fresh groom and will be hard to beat for a first run. Flow State will also be open to the public, so if you were captivated by ski or snowboard cross in the Olympics, you can try it out for yourself. 

As Presidents' Week keeps rolling, we've got a ton of fun events and extra activities, but you should really be checking out the Eddy and Betty Dinner tomorrow in South Ridge. Share a delicious dinner, play yeti-approved games, and snuggle up for a special story time with our favorite yetis in the cozy Yeti corner of the Mahoosuc Room. The fun starts at 5:30PM, so you can still get to bed early and be ready for first chair in the morning.

We'll see you out there!

-Team Snow
